newsitem.title: USA: Ford sets recall of nearly 680,000 vehicles.
newsitem.headline: Ford sets recall of nearly 680,000 vehicles.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said Wednesday it is recalling nearly 680,000 vehicles for various problems, including 419,180 1996-97 Taurus, Sable, Lincoln Continental and Windstar minivans for transmission inspections.
Ford said the park mechanism may not prevent the vehicle from rolling even if the shift lever is placed in the park position.
The recall involves 1996-97 models of the cars, and only 1996 versions of the minivan. Of the total vehicles, 19,613 are located in Canada.
Ford is recalling 248,515 1990-92 Probe coupes because the motorized seat belt assemblies may wear out. Those recalled include 8,022 in Canada.

Other recalls announced by Ford were: 5,950 1997 F-Super-Duty trucks with motorhome basic chassis, 89 of which are in Canada, because of battery cable insulation problems; 5,000 1996 Taurus SHO cars, 209 of which are in Canada, to replace fuel pressure regulators; and 1,300 1997 F-150 pickups, 73 of which are in Canada, for possible brake problems.

Ford spokeswoman Francine Romine-MacBride said the Probe repairs could take a full day. Other inspections and repairs are likely to take between one and two hours. Ford does not disclose the financial impacts of the recalls, she said.
There have been no reported accidents or injuries stemming from the transmission problems, Romine-MacBride said. Of the 419,180 recalled, she said about 360,000 are Taurus and Sable cars.
